newsitem.title: USA: Pathmark Stores Inc Q2 loss vs profit. [CORRECTED 17:07 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Pathmark Stores Inc Q2 loss vs profit. [CORRECTED 17:07 GMT]

text.p: (a) Includes sales generated by the freestanding drug stores of $41.0 million in the second quarter of fiscal 1995 and $86.5 million in the six-month period of fiscal 1995. During the second quarter of fiscal 1995, Pathmark decided to dispose of its 36 freestanding drug stores and, on July 28, 1995, completed the sale of 30 of its drug stores to Rite Aid Corporation. Five of the remaining six drug stores were closed during fiscal 1995 and the sixth store, which generated sales of $0.4 million during fiscal 1996, closed in the second quarter of fiscal 1996. (b) The fiscal 1995 income tax benefit includes a reversal of the deferred tax valuation allowance of $8.0 million and $9.1 million for the 13 and 26 weeks ended July 29, 1995, respectively. (c) Represents loss on early extinguishment of debt. (d) Operating cash flow represents earnings from operations before interest, income taxes, depreciation, amortization, the LIFO charge and unusual transactions.
